result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Dean Kendrick Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Dean Kendrick Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Dean Kendrick Jr. was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalty-Reckless Driving, etc.], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Felony Penalty-Hit and Run if Involved Death or Injury to a Person

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED.
Defendant to serve 120 days.
Huber granted for work and treatment.

***CORRECTED***

Court dismisses Counts 1 and 3.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and continue with payment plan until attorney bill received.
Restitution to be determined within 30 days.

Apply bond on file and continue with payment plan until attorney bill is received.
DNA surcharge.

-Follow all recommendations for treatment.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Defendant to participate in Restorative Justice Program.
-Maintain employment.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

Status conference on March 24, 2017 at 09:45 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Outpost Bar, Henry. M. and Shawn J.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Case called at 9:09 am. There is an agreement. ADA Minser recites. No objection from Atty Petros. Court questions re: agreement. Atty's respond.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #2. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #2. Counts #1 and #3 are dismissed. 15TR4684, 15TR4685 and 15TR4686 are aslo dismissed. Parties request another date for sentencing. Court orders a COMPAS. Address confirmed. Bond continues. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
